abstract: Editorial warns of latest moves by Republican lawmakers to erode rules governing corporate political donation disclosure and tax regulations governing political organizations; argues moves, targeting Securities and Exchange Commission and Internal Revenue Service, are natural outcome of Supreme Court's Citizen's United decision; laments current 'dark age' of campaign spending in which plutocrats exert outsize and opaque control over elections.
lead_paragraph: Two provisions in the spending bill just passed will make it even harder to regulate phantom donors.

headline.main: Political Dark Money Just Got Darker
headline.print_headline: Political Dark Money Just Got Darker

snippet: Two provisions in the spending bill just passed will make it even harder to regulate phantom donors.

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
